title: Elon Musk / DOGE - $300 Billion in Conflicts of Interest
summary: Trump gave world's richest man with $300+ billion in federal contracts unprecedented government access and power to slash spending. Ethics expert: 'If he participates... he commits a crime.' Musk later admitted DOGE was only 'somewhat successful' and regretted doing it.
keyFacts: Six companies with $300B+ in federal contracts (SpaceX, Tesla, Starlink, Neuralink, xAI, Boring Company)
Given 'full and prompt access to all unclassified agency records, software systems, and IT systems'
White House exempted Musk from filing public financial disclosure
Trump said Musk would 'identify his own conflicts' - itself a conflict of interest
Accessed Treasury payment systems (processes trillions of dollars)
NLRB investigating SpaceX and Tesla - while DOGE tried to cancel NLRB Buffalo office lease
SEC suing Musk for securities violations - while DOGE reviewed SEC
Democrats documented '100 conflicts of interest' in first 100 days
Promised trillions in savings; delivered only ~$200 billion
Musk later admitted: 'We were somewhat successful... I don't think so' when asked if he'd do it again
